title: Japan’s PM vows to stay on despite bruising election loss
byline: Japan’s ruling coalition has lost its majority in the country’s upper house, but Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has said he has no plans to quit.

title: Man wearing heavy metallic necklace dies after being sucked into MRI machine
byline: A 61-year-old man has died after he was sucked into a Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) machine at a medical centre while he was wearing a heavy metal necklace.

title: Asgiri Anunayake Thera passes away
byline: The Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter, Most Venerable Anamaduwa Dammadassi Thera, passed away at the age of 67.

title: ECB awarded hosting rights for the next three WTC Finals
byline: During the ICC Annual Conference 2025, it was confirmed that England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) have been awarded hosting rights for the next three World Test Championship Finals.

title: 21 injured in Galigamuwa bus accident
byline: At least 21 passengers were injured following a collision between two buses in Galigamuwa, within the Kegalla police area, early this morning, police said.

title: Ellen DeGeneres: I moved to the UK because of Trump
byline: US TV star Ellen DeGeneres has made her first public appearance since moving to the UK, saying she decided to settle in England the day after Donald Trump was re-elected US president.

title: Sri Lanka to consider oil purchases from U.S. to reduce trade gap
byline: Sri Lanka remains ready to consider oil purchases from the United States (U.S.) to reduce the trade gap as a qualification for further reduction of reciprocal tariffs, a Minister who is familiar with trade negotiations said.

title: Over 2,100 complaints filed with Bribery Commission in 2025
byline: Corruption within Sri Lanka’s state sector remains a growing concern, prompting increased action by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: 3 dead, 150 rescued after ferry catches fire in waters off Indonesia’s North Sulawesi province
byline: At least three people were killed and around 150 others rescued after a passenger ship caught fire in the waters off Indonesia’s North Sulawesi province on Sunday, officials and local media reported.

title: New education reforms will increase burden on students: Stalin
byline: The upcoming education reforms set to be launched in 2026 will further increase the burden on students, Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) General Secretary Joseph Stalin said.

title: Let the Whistle Blow Fair
byline: As the Dialog Schools Rugby League reaches its decisive stages, a controversial issue is quietly simmering beneath the surface — one that threatens the very integrity of the game.

title: Seven women hospitalised after inhaling fume at Kandy salon
byline: Seven women have been hospitalised after falling unconscious inside a beauty salon located on Peradeniya Road in Kandy this evening.

title: Acting IGP warns of rising non-communicable diseases in police force
byline: Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya has raised serious concerns about the health of Sri Lanka’s police force personnel, revealing that only 30% of police officers are in good physical condition, while the remaining majority suffer from non-communicable diseases (NCDs) or have not undergone proper medical check-ups.

title: Cardinal did not specifically request to appoint Shani, Ravi Seneviratne in prominent posts
byline: Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith never specifically requested for the appointments of Shani Abeysekera as CID Director or Ravi Seneviratne to be appointed as Secretary to the Ministry of Public Security, Director of the National Catholic Mass Communications, Fr. Jude Krishantha said today.

title: Conspiracy to destroy SJB, Sajith: Mujibur Rahman
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Mujibur Rahman dismissed rumours of an internal move to replace Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa, while warning of a deliberate conspiracy to politically weaken both the party and its leader.

title: Attempted nightclub shooting foiled in Kollupitiya
byline: An attempted shooting targeting an underworld gang member at a nightclub in the Kollupitiya area was thwarted when security personnel at the venue intervened and attacked the assailants.

title: Tsunami alert after powerful quakes strike off coast of Russia
byline: The Pacific Tsunami Warning Centre has issued a warning for Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula after two quakes - the larger with a magnitude of 7.4 - struck in the sea nearby on Sunday (July 20, 2025).

title: At least 14 dead in South Korea floods and landslides
byline: At least 14 people have died in floods and landslides caused by days of torrential rain in South Korea, the country’s disaster management office has said.

title: Teacher trainers to be trained under new education reforms: Minister
byline: Education Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya announced that starting in August, steps will be taken to train teacher trainers as part of the broader effort to improve teacher education and professional development in Sri Lanka.

title: Elephant runs amok during Ruwanwella Esala perahera
byline: A tense situation was reported in Ruwanwella last night when an elephant participating in the Esala Perahera went on a rampage.

title: Iranian national nabbed at BIA for attempting to travel with forged British passport
byline: A 47-year-old Iranian national was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) last night while attempting to flee to Europe using a forged British passport.

title: CEB technical engineers and superintendents to launch protest on Tuesday
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Technical Engineers and Superintendents Association has announced plans to launch a protest on Tuesday, July 22.

title: Ukraine seeks new round of talks with Russia
byline: Ukraine has proposed a new round of peace talks with Russia, President Volodymyr Zelensky has said, in a move aimed at restarting negotiations that halted last month.

title: At least 27 killed after Vietnam tourist boat capsizes in Halong Bay
byline: At least 27 people died after a tourist boat capsized in stormy weather in Vietnam’s Halong Bay on Saturday (July 19), state media reported.

title: Saudi Arabia’s ‘Sleeping Prince’ Prince Al Waleed bin Khaled dies after 20 years in coma
byline: Prince Al Waleed bin Khaled bin Talal Al Saud, known as the “Sleeping Prince,” has died after spending more than two decades in a coma following a traumatic car accident.

title: Three killed including two infants in Narammala accident
byline: Three people, including two infant girls, died in a tragic accident on the Narammala-Giriulla road in the Narammala Police Division yesterday afternoon (19).

title: Catholic Church does not want Nilantha Jayawardene sentenced to death: Fr. Cyril Gamini
byline: Referring to a comment made by Director, Mass Communications, Catholic Church of Sri Lanka Fr. Jude Krishantha that DIG Nilantha Jayawardene who was expelled from the police service should be subjected to death sentence, Director of Communications for the Archdiocese of Colombo, Fr. Cyril Gamini Fernando said today that it is not the official stance of the Catholic Church.

title: No exceptions for Dudley Sirisena in tank reservation clean-up: Lal Kantha
byline: Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation Minister K.D. Lal Kantha denied claims that a hotel owned by businessman Dudley Sirisena was spared from the government’s programme to remove illegal structures from irrigation tank reservations.

title: Fishermen warned to stay ashore as red alert issued for coastal waters
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ’Red Warning’ for strong winds and rough seas in several coastal regions of Sri Lanka urging the public especially fishing and naval communities to exercise extreme caution.

title: Colombo’s Port City to feature Big Ben-inspired Grand Clock
byline: A large-scale project is planned for construction in Port City Colombo, with an investment of over USD 540 million. The development aims to feature what could become the world’s largest art piece, complete with a 15-metre Grand Clock inspired by London’s Big Ben, and is expected to be submitted for recognition by the Guinness World Records.

title: Medical specialists raise red flag over new drug purchase rules
byline: Medical specialists have expressed serious concerns regarding the circular issued by the Ministry of Health outlining guidelines for the purchase of drugs, surgical items, by state hospitals from third parties.

title: Mahindananda, others granted bail in separate carrom board case
byline: Former Sports Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage, former Lanka Sathosa Chairman Nalin Fernando and former Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Army, (Rtd) Major General Nanda Mallawaarachchi, were today granted bail by the Colombo High Court after being served with indictments in connection with another case related to the controversial carrom board transaction, though involving separate charges.

title: 80kg of Kerala Cannabis seized in joint operation in Jaffna
byline: Acting on a tip-off from the Jaffna Army Intelligence Unit, a joint operation with the Nelliady Police Special Task Force led to the seizure of approximately 80 kilograms of Kerala cannabis, the Army said.

title: One dead, 33 affected due to high winds: DMC
byline: One person has died and 33 individuals from nine families have been affected in the Kalutara and Ratnapura districts following incidents caused by high winds and falling trees, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reported.

title: Tree fall cuts power in Talawakelle amid severe weather
byline: Talawakelle, July 21 (Daily Mirror) - A large tree fell onto a 33,000-watt high-voltage power line running from Hatton to Senclair in the Talawakelle area, causing extensive damage and widespread power outages, the Hatton Electricity Customer Service Center Electricity Superintendent Nimal Samarakoon said.

title: Sri Lanka to launch e-NICs by April 2026
byline: Electronic National Identity Cards (e-NICs) are expected to be issued by April 2026, Deputy Minister of Digital Economy, Eranga Weeraratne said.

title: At least one dead after fighter jet crashes into Bangladesh college campus
byline: A Bangladesh Air Force training jet has crashed into buildings at a college campus in the capital Dhaka, killing at least one person and injuring others on the ground.

title: Close shave for Air India Plane during Mumbai touchdown, engine damaged
byline: An Air India flight flying in from Kochi had a close shave while landing in Mumbai this morning after it veered off the rain-soaked runway. Pictures accessed by NDTV show a clump of grass stuck to the rear part of the aircraft and signs of damage on one of the engines. The runway, too, has been damaged. All passengers aboard the aircraft are safe, airport authorities have said.

title: U.S. reaffirms support for Colombo Plan’s Global Anti-Drug mission
byline: The United States has been a consistent partner, supporting technical assistance to the Colombo Plan, promoting evidence-based approaches and regional cooperation in the fight against illicit drugs, U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung said.

title: Foreign travel ban issued on Rohitha Abeygunawardena’s daughter
byline: A foreign travel ban was issued on former Minister Rohitha Abeygunawardenas’s daughter Rochelle Melanie Abeygunawardena and her husband by the Matugama Magistrate’s Court today.

title: 2025 Grade five exam on August 10
byline: The Examinations Department announced the date for holding the Grade 5 scholarship examination for 2025.

title: Restaurant owner fined Rs. 75,000 for selling insect-infested food
byline: Maligakanda Magistrate Lochana Abeywickrama Weerasinghe imposed a fine of Rs. 75,000 on a restaurant owner in Kollupitiya, after he pleaded guilty to selling insect-infested food.

title: CSE ends mixed as investors eye policy signals and trade talks
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a mixed note on July 21st, 2025, following a volatile trading session. The ASPI initially surged by nearly 155 points in early trading but faced selling pressure mid-session, dropping around 81 points before recovering to end with a gain of 70.38 points (+0.37%) at 19,044.08. Meanwhile, the S&P SL20 index dipped 8.44 points (-0.15%), settling at 5,646.99.

title: Injuries leading cause of hospitalizations; 12,000 deaths annually: Health Ministry
byline: Injuries have emerged as the leading cause of hospitalizations in Sri Lanka, with over one million people admitted to state hospitals each year due to injury-related incidents, the Health Ministry revealed in a communiqué issued recently.

title: Japan faces rice shortage as South Korea battles oversupply
byline: Japan is grappling with rice shortages and price hikes, forcing it to ramp up imports.

title: 1,241 individuals arrested within a day for drug-related offenses
byline: A total of 1,241 individuals were arrested for drug-related offenses, including illegal alcohol during a special operations conducted yesterday covering the entire island, Police said.

title: ’’Nilantha Jayawardene did his job’’; Dayasiri defends former SIS chief
byline: Former State Intelligence Service (SIS) Chief Nilantha Jayawardene has done his job as he has disseminated all information on events which led to the Easter Sunday attacks since 2015, MP Dayasiri Jayasekera said.

title: Sri Lanka will continue to benefit from IMF’s support: President expresses confidence
byline: While expressing his gratitude for the support extended to Sri Lanka by the IMF, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake expressed confidence that Sri Lanka would continue to benefit from the IMF’s support in ensuring long-term economic stability and consistency in policy direction.

title: Boating resumes at Gregory Lake despite weather warnings
byline: Despite a temporary ban imposed on boating activities at Gregory Lake due to severe weather conditions, boat operators resumed services today, citing continued economic pressure and dwindling tourist numbers.

title: Man injured in Seeduwa shooting
byline: Seeduwa, July 21 (Daily Mirror) - A man has been injured and hospitalized following a shooting incident in the Rajapaksapura area of Seeduwa this evening, police said.

title: Former army Chief-of-Staff files petition over carrom board indictments
byline: Former Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Army, (Rtd) Major General Nanda Mallawaarachchi has filed a writ petition before the Court of Appeal, challenging the Attorney General’s decision to indict him over the import of carrom boards and checker boards in 2014.

title: Consider past proposals on education reforms: Opposition
byline: The government should consider earlier proposals pertaining to education reforms and include suitable changes, some opposition elements said today.
